positive_factors: History of heart failure or LVEF < 45% in echocardiogram
Ongoing and progression in palpitation and limiting daily activities
Smaller left atrial size in echocardiogram

structurally_normal_heart: Class Ic (Flecainide, Propafenone) - Avoid if CAD or eGFR < 35
structurally_abnormal_heart: Sotalol (Class IIb, not suitable for LVEF < 40%)
Amiodarone (QTc check required, better to be avoided if QTc prolonged)
Dronedarone (QTc check required, better to be avoided if QTc prolonged)

persistent_AF.ablation: Only Class IIb recommendation for persistent AF

permanent_AF.treatment_pathway: AV node ablation + CRT or pacemaker implantation, no catheter ablation

temporal_control_mechanisms.pill_in_pocket (PIP): Palpitations occur less than a few times a week, longer duration of palpitation
regular_treatment: If palpitations occur most days of the week, regular treatment

structurally_normal_heart: Class Ic (Flecainide, Propafenone) - Avoid if CAD or eGFR < 35, sinus node dysfunction, atrioventricular block (type I, II, or III), or Brugada syndrome based on data from ECG in patient data
structurally_abnormal_heart: Sotalol (Class IIb, not suitable for LVEF < 40%)
Amiodarone (QTc check required, better to be avoided if QTc prolonged)
Dronedarone with mild structural heart disease (QTc check required, avoid if QTc>500, sinus node dysfunction, atrioventricular block (type I, II, or III) based on ECG data provided in patient data)

paroxysmal_AF.ablation: Class I recommendation for paroxysmal AF

temporal_strategy.flecainide: Very much suitable for PIP strategy

weighting_notes.specific_arrhythmia_patterns: Consider ablation earlier if: patient preference, AAD ineffective or poorly tolerated, younger, heart failure, progressive disease (more frequent/longer paroxysms), concomitant AF and flutter, pauses at termination of AF

additional_notes.parallel_strategies: Rate control and rhythm control are parallel strategies until near-perfect rhythm control is achieved
additional_notes.anticoagulation_for_ablation: Minimum 1 month before and 3 months after if not already on it
additional_notes.anticoagulation_for_cardioversion: If AF onset is unclear or >24hrs, a minimum of 1 month of anticoagulation or TOE-guidance is required
